Mega Millions jackpot grows to estimated $640m

Tonight's Mega Millions lottery jackpot has grown to $640 million, according to the Massachusetts Lottery. It is the largest lottery prize in history. (Globe, 12:05 p.m.)
  • share What would you do with lottery win?

Potential data breach at MasterCard

MasterCard Inc. said it's investigating a potential breach of account data and that card issuers and law enforcement have been notified. (Globe, 10:50 a.m.)
  • How to keep online accounts safe  |  Notable breaches

Remember when Burger King playfully introduced the left-handed Whopper? Or Starbucks adding mini-sizes to their lineup of lattes? See other April 1 business pranks.

College cancels Kennedy’s speech under pressure from Worcester bishop

Anna Maria College, a Catholic school, disinvited Victoria Kennedy from its commencement after a Worcester bishop found her views unfit. (Globe, 11:33 a.m.)

Menino protests proposed Comcast/Verizon Wireless deal

Mayor Menino has submitted a brief opposing a plan to allow Verizon Wireless, Comcast, and Time Warner to jointly market each other's products. (Globe, 11:26 a.m.)

Mass. health law could face challenges

If the Supreme Court strikes down President Obama's health care law, a lawsuit in Mass. — the first state with such a mandate — is likely to be the next step. (Globe)

Bin Laden lived in five houses

While on the run, Osama bin Laden lived in five safe houses in Pakistan and fathered four children, his youngest widow told investigators. The details raise questions over how he remained undetected for so long.
